page.title: 12Woodham Ferrers old folk
page.content: The following extracts are taken from tape recorded interviews at Eastham Old Folks Home: I was top at writing when I was at school. When I left school I remember going camping with the girl guides as I was patrol leader. I enjoyed my schooldays. When I left school to go to work I worked in Canning Town making books. My two sisters and I worked there. The people who owned it were Germans. I had some relations who were well off but I had to work hard. The world has changed and I am not proud of all the violence there is now. I would be nervous to go our now. I used to like going to the zoo. I was an animal lover. My son got killed in the army.He was in Australia doing his National Service when a gun blew up. I like watching television. Lively programmes are my favourite. Tea and Babycham favourite drinks.
